benchmark_details.name: ConvBench
benchmark_details.overview: ConvBench is a novel multi-turn conversation evaluation benchmark tailored for Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs), assessing capabilities in perception, reasoning, and creativity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multi-turn conversational capabilities of Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) using a hierarchical assessment approach that measures perception, reasoning, and creativity.

data.source: Multi-turn conversation scenarios based on a curated set of tasks reflecting real-world demands.

methodology.calculation: Scores are derived from the aggregated results of human evaluations and model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in understanding and responding to complex conversational cues.
methodology.baseline_results: Average scores for benchmark models like GPT-4-V in conversation tasks are reported.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's reliability and validity are tested against established evaluation metrics and previous standards.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collection procedures ensure user information is anonymized and retained confidentially.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is licensed under CC BY 4.0, allowing for redistribution and adaptation with proper attribution.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from all participants involved in annotations, if applicable.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Research complies with all applicable ethical standards and guidelines.
